replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Kelg,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZmkhkY9G,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-06-07T11:02:01.125+0000)
>
> maybe in iron

ive won 10 out of my past 11 games just playing tank jungles

> [{quoted}](name=Xavanic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZmkhkY9G,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-06-07T21:35:44.126+0000)
>
> ive won 10 out of my past 11 games just playing tank jungles

You aren't playing "Tank Junglers", you are playing Amumu in a low elo. That said, keep playing him. You will start losing. That is an extremely small sample size. Last season, I won 16 Maokai Top games in a row only to lose 10 in a row right after without altering my strategy at all. This season, I have a 100% win rate on Singed out of 13 games on another account. It doesn't mean anything. 

Your argument would feel a lot more impactful if you had a 60%+ win rate out of 100 or more games in Grandmaster/Challenger. Keep playing Amumu and come back with the results after you have played 100 games.

Keep in mind there is a big fucking difference between "Tank Junglers" and Amumu no matter what your results are. There are only 2 Tanks in the top 10, 4 Tanks in the Top 20, and 5 Tanks in the Top 40. There are 5 Fighters in the Top 10 alone.................... 9 Fighters in the Top 20........... 13 Fighters in the Top 30................   20 in the Top 40

There are even more Mages in the Jungle right now than there are Tanks. If you wanted to point toward one role that is the strongest though, then that is objectively Fighters. They dominate multiple roles right now and have for wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy too long at this point.

> [{quoted}](name=Pandemic Punch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZmkhkY9G,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2019-06-07T21:55:42.316+0000)
>
> You aren't playing "Tank Junglers", you are playing Amumu in a low elo. That said, keep playing him. You will start losing. That is an extremely small sample size. Last season, I won 16 Maokai Top games in a row only to lose 10 in a row right after without altering my strategy at all. This season, I have a 100% win rate on Singed out of 13 games on another account. It doesn't mean anything. 
> 
> Your argument would feel a lot more impactful if you had a 60%+ win rate out of 100 or more games in Grandmaster/Challenger. Keep playing Amumu and come back with the results after you have played 100 games.
> 
> Keep in mind there is a big fucking difference between "Tank Junglers" and Amumu no matter what your results are. There are only 2 Tanks in the top 10, 4 Tanks in the Top 20, and 5 Tanks in the Top 40. There are 5 Fighters in the Top 10 alone.................... 9 Fighters in the Top 20........... 13 Fighters in the Top 30................   20 in the Top 40
> 
> There are even more Mages in the Jungle right now than there are Tanks. If you wanted to point toward one role that is the strongest though, then that is objectively Fighters. They dominate multiple roles right now and have for wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy too long at this point.

Mid elo, not low, anything above iron/bronze is mid now, and the fact that im controlling the outcome of games kinda says something, considering im not even doing that well

> [{quoted}](name=Xavanic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZmkhkY9G,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2019-06-07T22:17:13.321+0000)
>
> Mid elo, not low, anything above iron/bronze is mid now, and the fact that im controlling the outcome of games kinda says something, considering im not even doing that well

You aren't doing very well "controlling" the outcome lately. As predicted in my original post. You haven't won a single game on a Tank Jungler since making this thread.

Trust me, our elo's are still low elo. If you want to prove your original point, you MUST have a much much larger sample size. At our elo's, anything below an 80% win rate is not impressive. 60% can be GOOD, but NOT impressive.

> [{quoted}](name=Pandemic Punch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZmkhkY9G,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2019-06-08T21:57:04.355+0000)
>
> You aren't doing very well "controlling" the outcome lately. As predicted in my original post. You haven't won a single game on a Tank Jungler since making this thread.
> 
> Trust me, our elo's are still low elo. If you want to prove your original point, you MUST have a much much larger sample size. At our elo's, anything below an 80% win rate is not impressive. 60% can be GOOD, but NOT impressive.

I will admit, there is only so much i can do when my teammates are oblivious, but i did win some games as a tank jungler, if you were to watch those games, you would completely understand why i lost those (bot refused to come get infernal after the enemy bot was dead instead opting for a bit of CS, teammates flaming everyone, someone picking corki, ezreal building iceborn against an ap heavy team, etc.) I'm still pretty set on them being fairly op rn, esp since i've been losing to tank junglers, but honestly, i feel i could easily reach diamond if not higher just by spamming tanks
Their clear speed is fairly quick
Their dps is decent for not building any dmg
additionally silver - plat, diamond - master is high elo, and challenger is challenger elo, hell why are you even arguing this anyways, 70% of the players are in bronze/iron
You post a thread with no arguments, not even explaining anything. Trash post that should be in Rant

> [{quoted}](name=FSRER,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZmkhkY9G,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-06-07T09:57:59.915+0000)
>
> You post a thread with no arguments, not even explaining anything. Trash post that should be in Rant

clear speed is too fast, ganks are too strong, remain relevent even when dumpstered
Tanks are broken asf and riot doesnt care what do you expect cheap items with champs with way to high of base dmg lol this game
